author: Staff Reporter
text:
Accuses AIADK func

A man was held, and let off with warning on Saturday after he tried to immolate himself at Poes Garden, over denial of permission to meet Chief Minister Jayalalithaa.

The man, identified as Ramaswamy (60) of Tiruchchirappalli, came to Poes Garden without any prior appointment and was stopped by security personnel who advised him to meet the personnel concerned.

Ramaswamy, who was dejected over the refusal, took out a bottle filled with kerosene, poured it on himself, and tried to commit self-immolation when the police intervened, and stopped him.

Police said the man alleged that an AIADMK party functionary in Tiruchi had cheated him of Rs.17 lakh by promising him a contract for development work in a village in the district. The man was taken to Teynampet Police Station, and let off.
title: 60-year-old held for self-immolation bid at Poes Garden
